Namespace: Templates

Views.Templates

Consilidate template modules into a dictionary to allow view constructors to reference them with the command pattern below.

Methods

(static) convertElement(elementHTML) → {Element}

Converts template literals into HTML element objects.

Note: This isn't straightforward because you can't edit an element objects outer HTML if it's not in the document, so a temporary wrapper element is used.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
elementHTML string The outer HTML of the element being created
Source:
  • templates/index.js, line 27
Returns:
- Element object
Type
Element

(static) module.exports(view, type) → {function}

Takes the view and element types as inputs and returns a function that accepts a model object and returns an HTML element.

The returned function calls the appropriate template function by creating a reference to members of nested objects, similar to a command pattern.

View
Parameters:
Name Type Description
view string View/Model type (Todo, Project, Project List)
type string Template type (standard, add, edit)
Source:
  • templates/index.js, line 73
Returns:
- Function that accepts a model and returns an Element object
Type
function
